text:
The JMX attributes from a JK Connector have some mysterious behavior over time. 
Without restart tomcat or the connector the values in this mbean (requestCount)
grow but decrease after some time. They "reset" not to 0! I can offer a chart of
this behavior. A HTTP connector works well. I use TC5 cvs 040601

The problems with counting more than one JK connector and the JMX naming problem
are solved with billbarker@apache.org patches to the cvs. Thank you.

Created attachment 11759
requestCount over time. should be crow all the time. fallback to 0 are reboots.

william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
It seems that RequestGroupInfo only counts the Request objects that are still 
alive.  Since JK Requests don't live as long a HTTP Requests, it's easier to 
see this problem with JK.
